questions.question_text: Where is Oracle APEX session state stored between calls from the browser?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"The Application Express engine establishes the identity of the user for each page request and the session ID to fetch *** session state *** from the database"
It's C according to quiz in oracle course.

comments.content: This is valid for session ID. The "sesson state" is stored into database as per the provided link

discussion.content:
It's A.
"This cookie is sent by the Application Express engine during authentication and is maintained for the life of the application (or browser) session."
Source : https://docs.oracle.com/database/apex-18.1/HTMDB/understanding-session-state-management.htm#HTMDB03009

choices.A: in the browser in the form of cookies
choices.D: is passed back and forth between the database and browser with each call

questions.question_text: You can control when an authorization scheme is validated by using the Evaluation Point. Select three valid Evaluation Points. (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
The correct is B. 
D is wrong. Using bind variable does no work
I tested D and it works

choices.B: Use the create link attribute and the &APEX$NEW_START_DATE. placeholder.
choices.A: Define a dynamic action of type Click in the calendar region.
choices.C: In the rendering tree, right-click the calendar region and select the Link Form to Calendar option.
choices.D: Use the create link attribute and use the :APEX$NEW_START_DATE bind variable.
choices.E: Use the view/edit link attribute to display the selected calendar entry.

questions.question_text:
Mark has created a modal form page to enter new calendar events. Mark now wants to call the form when an end user clicks an empty calendar spot.
How can Mark update the calendar region to call the form?

Rick has created an "editable" interactive grid on a table that includes four audit columns: CREATED, CREATED_BY, UPDATED, and UPDATED_BY.
The four audit columns are included in the report with read-only type set to Always.
How can Rick update all four audit columns when a user inserts a row, and the UPDATED and UPDATED_BY columns when a user updates a row?

choices.B: using default values on the report columns

questions.question_text: Which two actions can be done by a Page Process of type Automatic Row Processing (DML)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I think that is A,E. From the reference:
"Third, this process automatically performs lost update detection."
"For Process Attributes: Sequence - Specify a sequence number."

A and F
You can easily verify it by :
Creating a new region > interactive grid > (in attributes) Enabed yes > (in components) select the process with "interactive grid data" > (settings) Target type : PLSQL and below you can see "prevent lost updates"
How about A and D as an answer ?

choices.D: Apply a SQL WHERE clause to append to all generated INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE statements at run time.
choices.E: generate a primary key column value on a SQL INSERT statement.
choices.C: Log a user-defined message when an exception is raised.
choices.A: Perform automatic detection of lost updates.
choices.B: Perform CRUD operations on multiple tables.
choices.F: Invoke PL/SQL code to perform the inserts, updates, and deletes.
